channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Moonvalley releases its ‘power tool’ for AI filmmaking
item.description: On Tuesday, AI lab Moonvalley announced the public release of Marey, a video model designed as a production-grade tool for professional filmmakers. Ma...

item.title: Users accuse Elon Musk’s Grok of a rightward tilt after xAI changes its internal instructions to assume viewpoints from the media are ‘biased’
item.description: Grok’s new instructions tell it not to shy away from “politically incorrect” viewpoints.

item.title: Amazon is extending Prime Day deals in 2025, here’s why
item.description: Amazon is extending its annual Prime Day sales and offering new membership perks to Gen Z shoppers amid tariff-related price worries and possibly some...

item.title: Mark Cuban, Barbara Corcoran, and Robert Herjavec to Join Clover x Shark Tank Summit
item.description: Some of America’s best-known entrepreneurs will share strategies and advice for small-business owners at the three-day event in September.

item.title: Main Street Says Good Help Is Hard to Find, According to Small Business Survey
item.description: The NFIB’s monthly small business confidence index held steady for June, but owners continued to report problems finding qualified employees.

item.title: Meet the ex-Amazon exec who pitched Prime Day to Jeff Bezos—and turned the slowest shopping season into a $14.2 billion sales empire
item.description: You can thank Diego Piacentini, the architect of Prime Day, for one of the biggest online retail events of the year.

item.title: Tesla sold precisely zero cars in Turkey in January—now it’s Elon Musk’s hottest market. Here’s why
item.description: The Eurasian country came within striking distance of becoming Tesla's third largest global market for the month of June, but analysts question the su...

item.title: Elon Musk calls the U.S. dollar ‘hopeless,’ says his America Party will embrace Bitcoin
item.description: Short statement could have broad implications.

item.title: What happened at Wimbledon? ‘Human error’ blamed for ball-tracking tech mishap
item.description: The All England Club, somewhat ironically, is blaming “human error” for a glaring mistake by the electronic system that replaced human line judges thi...

item.title: The internet is trying—and failing—to spend Elon Musk’s $342 billion
item.description: How would you spend $342 billion? A number of games called “Spend Elon Musk’s Money” have been popping up online, inviting users to imagine how they’d...

item.title: President Trump’s Tariffs Complicate the Fed’s Next Move
item.description: Rising trade tensions and cooling inflation put Jerome Powell at risk of a policy error.

item.title: Succeeding on Substack Is Harder Than It Looks
item.description: Before you enter the insane, hurry up business of content, consider the competition.

item.title: What’s more American than Big Bear’s famous bald eagles? Maybe protecting them from fireworks
item.description: There’s nothing more American than fireworks, the Fourth of July, and bald eagles. Unfortunately the combination of the first two elements is stressfu...

item.title: Tesla bull Dan Ives says the company has reached a ‘tipping point’ and lays out a 3-point plan for the board to rein in Elon Musk
item.description: The analyst thinks Musk needs a new pay plan and a board committee that's dedicated to limiting, but not banning, the CEO's political activities.

item.title: Skilled Immigrants Boost Entrepreneurship and Create Jobs, a New Study Says
item.description: The fight between White House factions over immigration rules for skilled workers has grown vicious. New research could help end the debate.
